meanings.definition: A person who supports or advocates for colonialism.
meanings.sent1: The colonialist believed in expanding their country's power through colonization.
meanings.sent2: The colonialist spoke passionately about the benefits of colonial rule.
meanings.sent3: The colonialist joked that they were on a mission to turn the world into one big colony.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a colonialist, always trying to conquer new territories in board games.
meanings.sent5: The image of the colonialist in his pith helmet was etched in her mind.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of colonialism.
meanings.sent1: The colonialist policies aimed to establish control over distant lands.
meanings.sent2: The colonialist architecture in the city reflected a bygone era of imperialism.
meanings.sent3: The colonialist decor in the restaurant transported diners back to a different time.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was filled with colonialist-inspired clothing from her travels.
meanings.sent5: The colonialist flag fluttered proudly in the wind, symbolizing past conquests.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a colony or colonies.
meanings.sent1: The colonialist government enacted laws governing its overseas territories.
meanings.sent2: The colonialist trade routes connected the motherland to its colonies.
meanings.sent3: The colonialist wildlife reserve aimed to protect native species in the colony.
meanings.sent4: Her colonialist passport allowed her to travel freely within the empire.
meanings.sent5: The colonialist settlement thrived with bustling markets and diverse cultures.
